actor_awards.notes: Best known as the 'Queen of Scream' for her role as Ann Darrow in 'King Kong' (1933). She received a posthumous Saturn Award for the 1933 King Kong release on DVD. She has two stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame (Motion Picture and Television).

filmography.title: King Kong
filmography.role_description: An unemployed actress who travels to a remote island to star in a film, where she is captured by a giant ape who falls in love with her.
filmography.plot: A film crew goes to a tropical island for an exotic location shoot and discovers a colossal ape who takes a shine to their female blonde star.

filmography.title: The Most Dangerous Game
filmography.role_description: A shipwreck survivor who becomes the prey of a mad count who hunts humans for sport.
filmography.plot: An insane hunter arranges for a ship to be wrecked on an island where he can indulge in some sort of hunting and killing of the passengers.

filmography.title: Mystery of the Wax Museum
filmography.role_description: The roommate of a reporter who is targeted by a disfigured sculptor to become the centerpiece of his wax museum.
filmography.plot: Bodies are disappearing from the morgue and a new wax museum is opening, featuring sculptures that look suspiciously lifelike.

filmography.title: Doctor X
filmography.role_description: The daughter of a doctor who is investigating a series of 'Moon Killer' murders committed by one of his colleagues.
filmography.plot: A wisecracking reporter investigates a series of cannibalistic murders at a medical college.

filmography.title: The Vampire Bat
filmography.role_description: The love interest in a village plagued by murders attributed to giant bats.
filmography.plot: When corpses drained of blood begin to show up in a European village, the townspeople suspect a vampire is on the loose.

filmography.title: The Wedding March
filmography.role_description: A poor girl who falls in love with an aristocratic officer in Erich von Stroheim's silent epic.
filmography.plot: In Vienna, an aristocratic officer falls in love with a poor girl, but his family forces him to marry for money.

filmography.title: The Four Feathers
filmography.role_description: The fiancée of a British officer who resigns his commission and is branded a coward.
filmography.plot: A British officer resigns his commission on the eve of a campaign in Sudan and is given four white feathers as symbols of cowardice.

filmography.title: The Bowery
filmography.role_description: A girl who becomes the center of a rivalry between two rough-and-tumble icons of the Bowery.
filmography.plot: Two rival saloon owners in the Bowery district of New York City constantly try to outdo each other with pranks and wagers.

filmography.title: One Sunday Afternoon
filmography.role_description: The girl that the main character, Biff Grimes, originally wants to marry before settling for her friend.
filmography.plot: A dentist looks back on his life and realizes he married the right girl after all, despite initially pining for her friend.

filmography.title: Viva Villa!
filmography.role_description: An aristocrat's sister who becomes involved with the revolutionary Pancho Villa.
filmography.plot: A fictionalized biography of Pancho Villa as he rises from bandit to revolutionary general fighting against the tyrannical rule in Mexico.

filmography.title: The Affairs of Cellini
filmography.role_description: A model who poses for the artist Benvenuto Cellini.
filmography.plot: A comedic take on the life of artist Benvenuto Cellini, focusing on his romantic entanglements with the Duchess of Florence.

filmography.title: The Richest Girl in the World
filmography.role_description: The friend of a wealthy heiress who switches places with her to test a suitor's love.
filmography.plot: The richest girl in the world switches places with her secretary to find a man who will love her for herself, not her money.

filmography.title: Dirigible
filmography.role_description: The wife of a dirigible commander who worries about his dangerous expeditions.
filmography.plot: Two pilots compete for the love of a woman and the glory of being the first to reach the South Pole by air.

filmography.title: Ann Carver's Profession
filmography.role_description: A successful female lawyer who must defend her husband in court.
filmography.plot: A female lawyer's success strains her marriage, but she must rise to the occasion when her husband is accused of murder.

filmography.title: The Clairvoyant
filmography.role_description: The wife of a fake psychic who begins to have real visions of impending disasters.
filmography.plot: A fake music hall clairvoyant meets a woman who seems to give him true psychic powers, predicting disasters.

filmography.title: Bulldog Jack
filmography.role_description: The granddaughter of a boomerang maker who is kidnapped by criminals.
filmography.plot: A man poses as Bulldog Drummond to help a girl whose grandfather has been kidnapped by a gang.

filmography.title: Adam Had Four Sons
filmography.role_description: The wife of Adam who dies early in the film, leaving him to raise their sons with the help of a governess.
filmography.plot: A governess cares for a widower's four sons and secretly loves him, but trouble arrives when one son brings home a scheming wife.

filmography.title: Hell on Frisco Bay
filmography.role_description: A film star and former girlfriend of the protagonist who helps him clear his name.
filmography.plot: An ex-cop released from prison searches for the man who framed him for manslaughter.

filmography.title: Tammy and the Bachelor
filmography.role_description: The disapproving mother of the bachelor who falls for the backwoods girl Tammy.
filmography.plot: A backwoods girl nurses a crashed pilot back to health and later visits him at his plantation home, charming his family.

filmography.title: Small Town Girl
filmography.role_description: The mother of the main character who dreams of a more exciting life for her daughter.
filmography.plot: A rich playboy is arrested for speeding in a small town and falls for the judge's daughter.

filmography.title: Summer Love
filmography.role_description: The mother of the young musician protagonist in this teen musical.
filmography.plot: A teen band gets a gig at a summer camp, leading to romance and complications.

filmography.title: Crime of Passion
filmography.role_description: The wife of a police captain who is involved in the social climbing and murder plot.
filmography.plot: An advice columnist gives up her career to marry a detective but becomes frustrated by his lack of ambition, leading to murder.

filmography.title: Treasure of the Golden Condor
filmography.role_description: A French aristocrat involved in the intrigue surrounding a treasure hunt.
filmography.plot: A young man in 18th-century France is cheated out of his birthright and goes to Guatemala to find a treasure.

filmography.title: Dragstrip Riot
filmography.role_description: The mother of a teenager involved in drag racing and gang conflicts.
filmography.plot: A young man trying to leave his past behind gets drawn into a rivalry with a motorcycle gang.

filmography.title: Master of Men
filmography.role_description: The supportive wife of a steel mill worker who rises to management.
filmography.plot: A steel worker rises to a management position but loses his friends and wife in the process due to his ambition.

filmography.title: Below the Sea
filmography.role_description: A wealthy woman who funds a deep-sea diving expedition.
filmography.plot: A deep-sea diver and a wealthy woman go on an expedition to photograph underwater life and recover gold.

filmography.title: Smashing the Spy Ring
filmography.role_description: A secret agent working to uncover a spy ring operating in Washington D.C.
filmography.plot: An undercover agent feigns insanity to infiltrate a spy ring that is stealing gas formulas.
